dsDescriptionValue.value: Microwaves travel line of sight, unlike lower frequency radio waves and its photon energy is around 1.24 meV – 1.24µeV. They are form of electromagnetic waves with wavelength longer than that of terahertz wavelength but comparatively short for radio wave. Nevertheless, the boundaries among far infrared light, terahertz radiation, microwaves and ultra-high frequency radio waves are subjective and are used in wide range between various fields of study. Few of them below are discussed from abundant sources of Microwaves applications which will help to move further with the research and development.

publicationCitation.value: Mitra M. Microwave and its advancements. Eng Press. 2018; 2(1): 73-75. doi: 10.28964/EngPress-2-114
